metadata.title: CVE-2020-9484 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
When using Apache Tomcat versions 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.0-M4, 9.0.0.M1 to9.0.34, 8.5.0 to 8.5.54 and 7.0.0 to 7.0.103 if a) an attacker is able tocontrol the contents and name of a file on the server; and b) the server isconfigured to use the PersistenceManager with a FileStore; and c) thePersistenceManager is configured withsessionAttributeValueClassNameFilter="null" (the default unless aSecurityManager is used) or a sufficiently lax filter to allow the attackerprovided object to be deserialized; and d) the attacker knows the relativefile path from the storage location used by FileStore to the file theattacker has control over; then, using a specifically crafted request, theattacker will be able to trigger remote code execution via deserializationof the file under their control. Note that all of conditions a) to d) mustbe true for the attack to succeed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9484` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.16+esm1
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.16+esm1
tomcat7 - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.16+esm1
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.16+esm1
tomcat7-common - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.16+esm1
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.16+esm1
tomcat7-user - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.16+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.52-1ubuntu0.16+esm1').
